parsed.internal_thinking: I have just purchased a development card, which has been revealed in my hidden hand as a 'Road Building' card. According to standard Catan rules, I cannot play this card on the same turn it was purchased. My current resources are down to a single Wheat, which is insufficient for any further constructions, development card purchases, or meaningful trades. My position on the board is currently balanced, with settlements at Node 20 (W11, B6, S8) and Node 44 (O2, Wh9, Wh6). My next strategic move will be to use the Road Building card on my next turn to expand toward the 3:1 ports. Specifically, building from Node 10 to Node 9 will provide access to a port and the 8-Sheep/12-Wood hexes, while extending from Node 52 to Node 51 will secure another 3:1 port and the 9-Wheat hex. This expansion will also increase my road length, putting me in a better position for the Longest Road later in the game. Since I have no other viable actions this turn, I will conclude my turn. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: I have a Road Building card ready for next turn. Plan: Build roads [10, 9] and [52, 51] to secure two 3:1 ports. Priority for resources: Wood, Brick, and Sheep for settlements at these new nodes. Watch AI_2, who is expanding in the south near the 9-Wheat and 5-Ore hexes.
parsed.say_outloud: I've got my development card, so I'm curious to see how the next few rolls treat us. Good luck on your turns, everyone!
